cyclone.name: ZETA
cyclone.current_location: about 320 mi SSW of the mouth of the Mississippi River
cyclone.trajectory: accelerating north then north-northeast toward southeastern Louisiana with the center expected to cross the Mississippi coast and then race inland across Alabama and the Southeast U.S.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: southeastern Louisiana (near Morgan City–Grand Isle area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical Storm Watch west of Morgan City to Intracoastal City, LA
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning Morgan City, LA to the Mississippi/Alabama border (includes Pascagoula); Tropical Storm Warning eastward to Walton/Bay County Line, FL
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Gulf Coast from southeast Louisiana across the entire Mississippi coast into coastal Alabama and the western Florida Panhandle
weather_observation.wind: Hurricane-force winds (sustained 75-90 mph with higher gusts) possible Wednesday afternoon–evening; tropical-storm-force winds arrive by midday
weather_observation.storm_surge: 3–5 ft of inundation possible along the Mississippi coast including Pascagoula with locally higher water levels where onshore flow coincides with high tide
weather_observation.rainfall: 2–4 inches with isolated 6 inches, producing flash- and urban-flood risk
weather_observation.other_hazards: A few tornadoes possible Wednesday afternoon through Wednesday night in coastal Mississippi and Alabama
